00096 typedef unsigned long xnarch_cpumask_t;
00097 #define xnarch_num_online_cpus()         XNARCH_NR_CPUS
00098 #define xnarch_cpu_online_map            ((1<<xnarch_num_online_cpus()) - 1)
00099 #define xnarch_cpu_set(cpu, mask)        ((mask) |= 1 << (cpu))
00100 #define xnarch_cpu_clear(cpu, mask)      ((mask) &= 1 << (cpu))
00101 #define xnarch_cpus_clear(mask)          ((mask) = 0UL)
00102 #define xnarch_cpu_isset(cpu, mask)      (!!((mask) & (1 << (cpu))))
00103 #define xnarch_cpus_and(dst, src1, src2) ((dst) = (src1) & (src2))
00104 #define xnarch_cpus_equal(mask1, mask2)  ((mask1) == (mask2))
00105 #define xnarch_cpus_empty(mask)          ((mask) == 0UL)
00106 #define xnarch_cpumask_of_cpu(cpu)       (1 << (cpu)) 
00107 #define xnarch_first_cpu(mask)           (ffnz(mask))
00108 #define XNARCH_CPU_MASK_ALL              (~0UL)
00109 
00110 #define xnarch_ullmod(ull,uld,rem)   ((*rem) = ((ull) % (uld)))
00111 #define xnarch_uldivrem(ull,uld,rem) ((u_long)xnarch_ulldiv((ull),(uld),(rem)))
00112 #define xnarch_uldiv(ull, d)         xnarch_uldivrem(ull, d, NULL)
00113 #define xnarch_ulmod(ull, d)         ({ u_long _rem;                    \
00114                                         xnarch_uldivrem(ull,d,&_rem); _rem; })
00115 
00116 static inline int xnarch_imuldiv(int i, int mult, int div)
00117 {
00118     unsigned long long ull = (unsigned long long) (unsigned) i * (unsigned) mult;
00119     return ull / (unsigned) div;
00120 }
00121 
00122 static inline unsigned long long __xnarch_ullimd(unsigned long long ull,
00123                                                  u_long m,
00124                                                  u_long d) {
00125 
00126     unsigned long long mh, ml;
00127     u_long h, l, mlh, mll, qh, r, ql;
00128 
00129     h = ull >> 32; l = ull & 0xffffffff; /* Split ull. */
00130     mh = (unsigned long long) h * m;
00131     ml = (unsigned long long) l * m;
00132     mlh = ml >> 32; mll = ml & 0xffffffff; /* Split ml. */
00133     mh += mlh;
00134     qh = mh / d;
00135     r = mh % d;
00136     ml = (((unsigned long long) r) << 32) + mll; /* assemble r and mll */
00137     ql = ml / d;
00138 
00139     return (((unsigned long long) qh) << 32) + ql;
00140 }
00141 
00142 static inline long long xnarch_llimd(long long ll, u_long m, u_long d) {
00143     if(ll < 0)
00144         return -__xnarch_ullimd(-ll, m, d);
00145     return __xnarch_ullimd(ll, m, d);
00146 }
00147 
00148 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ullmul(unsigned long m1,
00149                                                unsigned long m2) {
00150     return (unsigned long long) m1 * m2;
00151 }
00152 
00153 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00154                                                 unsigned long uld,
00155                                                 unsigned long *rem)
00156 {
00157     if (rem)
00158         *rem = ull % uld;
00159 
00160     return ull / uld;
00161 }

00170 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00171 
00172     const char *name;           /* Symbolic name of thread (can be NULL) */
00173     struct xnthread *thread;    /* VM thread pointer (opaque) */
00174     void *khandle;              /* Kernel handle (opaque) */
00175     void (*entry)(void *);      /* Thread entry */
00176     void *cookie;               /* Thread cookie passed on entry */
00177     int imask;                  /* Initial interrupt mask */
00178     jmp_buf rstenv;             /* Restart context info */
00179     pthread_t thid;
00180     xncompletion_t completion;
00181 
00182 } xnarchtcb_t;

00206 static inline int __attribute__ ((unused))
00207 xnarch_read_environ (const char *name, const char **ptype, void *pvar)
00208 
00209 {
00210     char *value;
00211 
00212     if (*ptype == NULL)
00213         return 0;       /* Already read in */
00214 
00215     value = getenv(name);
00216 
00217     if (!value)
00218         return -1;
00219 
00220     if (**ptype == 's')
00221         *((char **)pvar) = value;
00222     else if (strstr(*ptype,"int"))
00223         *((int *)pvar) = atoi(value);
00224     else if (strstr(*ptype,"long"))
00225         *((u_long *)pvar) = (u_long)atol(value);
00226 
00227     *ptype = NULL;
00228 
00229     return 1;
00230 }
00231 
00232 static inline int xnarch_lock_irq (void)
00233 {
00234     return xnarch_atomic_xchg(&uvm_irqlock,1);
00235 }
00236 
00237 static inline void xnarch_unlock_irq (int x)
00238 {
00239     extern unsigned long uvm_irqpend;
00240 
00241     if (!x && uvm_irqlock)
00242         {
00243         if (xnarch_atomic_xchg(&uvm_irqpend,0))
00244             uvm_thread_release(&uvm_irqlock);
00245         else
00246             uvm_irqlock = 0;
00247         }
00248 }

00260 #ifdef XENO_INTR_MODULE
00261 
00262 unsigned long uvm_irqlock = 0;  /* =1 whenever IRQs are off. */
00263 
00264 unsigned long uvm_irqpend = 0;  /* =1 whenever IRQs are pending. */
00265 
00266 void xnarch_sync_irq (void) /* Synchronization point for IRQ servers. */
00267 
00268 {
00269     if (uvm_irqlock)
00270         /* IRQs are off. Set the IRQ pending flag and go to sleep,
00271            waiting for the IRQs to be unmasked. */
00272         uvm_thread_hold(&uvm_irqpend);
00273 }
00274

00276                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00277                                                    void *cookie),
00278                                    int (*ackfn)(unsigned irq),
00279                                    void *cookie)
00280 {
00281     return -ENOSYS;
00282 }

00337 static void xnarch_restart_handler (int sig) {
00338 
00339     longjmp(uvm_current->rstenv,1);
00340 }
00341 
00342 int main (int argc, char *argv[])
00343 
00344 {
00345     struct sigaction sa;
00346     int err;
00347 
00348     if (geteuid() != 0)
00349         {
00350         fprintf(stderr,"This program must be run with root privileges.\n");
00351         exit(1);
00352         }
00353 
00354     err = __xeno_sys_init();
00355 
00356     if (err)
00357         {
00358         fprintf(stderr,"sys_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00359         exit(2);
00360         }
00361 
00362     err = __xeno_skin_init();
00363 
00364     if (err)
00365         {
00366         fprintf(stderr,"skin_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00367         exit(3);
00368         }
00369 
00370     err = __xeno_user_init();
00371 
00372     if (err)
00373         {
00374         fprintf(stderr,"user_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00375         exit(4);
00376         }
00377 
00378     mlockall(MCL_CURRENT|MCL_FUTURE);
00379 
00380     sa.sa_handler = &xnarch_restart_handler;
00381     sigemptyset(&sa.sa_mask);
00382     sa.sa_flags = SA_RESTART;
00383     sigaction(XNARCH_SIG_RESTART,&sa,NULL);
00384 
00385     for (;;)
00386         uvm_thread_idle(&uvm_irqlock);
00387 
00388     __xeno_user_exit();
00389     __xeno_skin_exit();
00390     __xeno_sys_exit();
00391 
00392     exit(0);
00393 }
00394 
00395 #endif  /* !XENO_MAIN_MODULE */

00416 #ifdef XENO_POD_MODULE
00417 
00418 extern void *uvm_timer_handle;
00419 
00420 xnsysinfo_t uvm_info;
00421 
00422 xnarchtcb_t *uvm_root;
00423 
00424 xnarchtcb_t *uvm_current;
00425 
00426 struct xnarch_tick_parms {
00427     unsigned long nstick;
00428     void (*tickhandler)(void);
00429     xncompletion_t completion;
00430 };
00431 
00432 /*
00433  * NOTE: System-level shadow priorities underlying the UVM threads are
00434  * defined as follows:
00435  *
00436  * - uvm-root = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO)
00437  * - uvm-<user> = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 1
00438  * - uvm-timer = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 2
00439  */
00440 
00441 static void *xnarch_timer_thread (void *cookie)
00442 
00443 {
00444     struct xnarch_tick_parms *p = (struct xnarch_tick_parms *)cookie;
00445     void (*tickhandler)(void);
00446     struct sched_param param;
00447     unsigned long nstick;
00448     long err;
00449 
00450     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 2;
00451     sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00452 
00453     /* Copy the following values laid into our parent's stack before
00454        it is unblocked from the completion by uvm_thread_create(). */
00455     tickhandler = p->tickhandler;
00456     nstick = p->nstick;
00457 
00458     uvm_thread_create("uvm-timer",NULL,&p->completion,&uvm_timer_handle);
00459 
00460     err = uvm_thread_barrier(); /* Wait for start. */
00461 
00462     if (!err)
00463         err = uvm_thread_set_periodic(0,nstick);
00464 
00465     if (err)
00466         pthread_exit((void *)err);
00467 
00468     for (;;)
00469         {
00470         if (uvm_thread_wait_period() == -EWOULDBLOCK) /* Timer killed? */
00471             break;
00472 
00473         xnarch_sync_irq();
00474         tickhandler();
00475         }
00476 
00477     pthread_exit(NULL);
00478 }
00479 
00480 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long nstick,
00481                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00482 {
00483     struct xnarch_tick_parms parms;
00484     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00485     pthread_t thid;
00486     int err;
00487 
00488     if (nstick == 0) /* UVM does not provide oneshot timing. */
00489         return -ENODEV;
00490 
00491     /* However, if we use the oneshot timing which is always available
00492        at kernel level so that we can provide a better resolution for
00493        virtual machine. */
00494 
00495     err = uvm_timer_start(0);
00496 
00497     if (err)
00498         return err;
00499 
00500     parms.nstick = nstick;
00501     parms.tickhandler = tickhandler;
00502     parms.completion.syncflag = 0;
00503     parms.completion.pid = -1;
00504 
00505     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00506     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00507 
00508     err = pthread_create(&thid,&thattr,&xnarch_timer_thread,&parms);
00509 
00510     if (err)
00511         return -err;
00512 
00513     err = uvm_thread_sync(&parms.completion);
00514 
00515     if (err == 0)
00516         uvm_thread_start(uvm_timer_handle);
00517 
00518     return err;
00519 }
00520 
00521 static inline void xnarch_leave_root(xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00522 }
00523 
00524 static inline void xnarch_enter_root(xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00525 }

00527 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00528                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00529 {
00530     uvm_current = in_tcb;
00531     uvm_thread_activate(in_tcb->khandle,out_tcb->khandle);
00532 }
00533 
00534 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00535                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00536 {
00537     uvm_current = next_tcb;
00538     uvm_thread_cancel(dead_tcb->khandle,next_tcb->khandle);
00539 }
00540 
00541 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00542 
00543 {
00544     uvm_thread_cancel(dead_tcb->khandle,NULL);
00545 }
00546 
00547 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00548                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00549                                          const char *name)
00550 {
00551     struct sched_param param;
00552     int err;
00553 
00554     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO);
00555     sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00556     err = uvm_system_info(&uvm_info);
00557 
00558     if (err)
00559         {
00560         fprintf(stderr,"UVM init failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00561         exit(1);
00562         }
00563 
00564     uvm_thread_shadow("uvm-root",tcb,&tcb->khandle);
00565     tcb->name = name;
00566     uvm_root = uvm_current = tcb;
00567 }
00568 
00569 static void *xnarch_thread_trampoline (void *cookie)
00570 
00571 {
00572     xnarchtcb_t *tcb = (xnarchtcb_t *)cookie;
00573     struct sched_param param;
00574     long err;
00575 
00576     if (!setjmp(tcb->rstenv))
00577         {
00578         param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 1;
00579         sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00580         uvm_thread_create(tcb->name,tcb,&tcb->completion,&tcb->khandle);
00581         err = uvm_thread_barrier();     /* Wait for start. */
00582         if (err)
00583             pthread_exit((void *)err);
00584         }
00585 
00586     xnarch_setimask(tcb->imask);
00587 
00588     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->thread);
00589 
00590     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00591 
00592     pthread_exit(NULL);
00593 }
00594 
00595 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00596                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00597                                        void *cookie,
00598                                        int imask,
00599                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00600                                        char *name)
00601 {
00602     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00603     int err;
00604 
00605     if (tcb->khandle)   /* Restarting thread */
00606         {
00607         pthread_kill(tcb->thid,XNARCH_SIG_RESTART);
00608         return;
00609         }
00610 
00611     tcb->imask = imask;
00612     tcb->entry = entry;
00613     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00614     tcb->thread = thread;
00615     tcb->name = name;
00616     tcb->completion.syncflag = 0;
00617     tcb->completion.pid = -1;
00618 
00619     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00620     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00621 
00622     err = pthread_create(&tcb->thid,&thattr,&xnarch_thread_trampoline,tcb);
00623 
00624     if (!err)
00625         uvm_thread_sync(&tcb->completion);
00626     else
00627         xnarch_logerr("pthread_create() failed for thread %s (err %d)\n",name,err);
00628 }

00645 
00646 int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00647 
00648 {
00649     spl_t s;
00650     splhigh(s);
00651     splexit(!!imask);
00652     return !!s;
00653 }
00654 
00655 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00656 
00657     return 0;
00658 }

00661 
00662     return 0;

00670 #define xnarch_notify_ready()  /* Nullified */
00671 #define xnarch_notify_shutdown() /* Nullified */
00672 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00673 
00674 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_sys_time(void)
00675 {
00676     struct timeval tv;
00677 
00678     if(gettimeofday(&tv, NULL))
00679         {
00680         printf("Warning, gettimeofday failed, error %d\n", errno);
00681         return 0;
00682         }
00683 
00684     return tv.tv_sec * 1000000000ULL + tv.tv_usec * 1000;
00685 }

00703 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (unsigned long long tsc) {
00704 
00705     nanostime_t ns;
00706     return uvm_timer_tsc2ns(tsc,&ns) ? 0 : ns;
00707 }
00708 
00709 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (unsigned long long ns) {
00710 
00711     nanostime_t tsc;
00712     return uvm_timer_ns2tsc(ns,&tsc) ? 0 : tsc;
00713 }

00715 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void)
00716 
00717 {
00718     nanotime_t t;
00719     uvm_timer_read(&t);
00720     return t;
00721 }
00722 
00723 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_tsc (void)
00724 
00725 {
00726     nanotime_t t;
00727     uvm_timer_tsc(&t);
00728     return t;
00729 }

00731 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00732     return uvm_info.cpufreq;
00733 }

00735 static inline void xnarch_halt (const char *emsg) {
00736     fprintf(stderr,"UVM fatal: %s\n",emsg);
00737     fflush(stderr);
00738     exit(99);
00739 }
